> The existence of the Composite pattern in the 
> Test/TestCa=
se/TestSuite troika caused us problems. It was 
> difficult to explain and =
it made writing test runners more 
> difficult. One particularly vexing pro=
blem was re-running 
> single tests while making sure all the TestDecorator=
s and 
> TestSuite subclasses higher in the test tree were run 
> correctly=
.

I'm not sure I see the problem?  TestNG does that and can even calculate=

dependencies to make sure that dependent methods are run before the method=

you really want to run is executed.

The framework should only see a list =
of methods to call, that's true, but
letting users specify hierarchies of t=
ests can be handy.
